data.title: Nourish Your Need For Nature
data.meta_description: Dodge Nature Center is an environmental education organization in Minnesota with 4 metro nature destinations located in West St. Paul, Cottage Grove and Mendota Heights. Founded in 1967 by Olivia Irvine Dodge, the organization was one of the first nature centers in the state of Minnesota. Dodge Nature Center and Preschool are recognized nationally in the field of environmental education.
data.text:
Since 1967, Dodge has been connecting children and adults to nature. With a mission to provide exceptional experiences in nature through environmental education, Dodge Nature Center and Preschool are nationally recognized. Nourish Your Need For Nature™ on our trails or by joining a nature program.

Plan Your Visit

We're hiring!

Join the team! We’re hiring for several positions at the nature center and preschool:

Groundskeeper / Restoration Specialist

Substitute Teacher

Lunch Bunch Teacher

Seasonal Naturalist

Come be part of a passionate team dedicated to providing exceptional experiences in environmental education.

See Positions

Join the Dodge Hiking Challenge

Put Dodge’s trails on your summer bucket list! Explore all four of our properties to earn a super cool sticker. Along the way, you’ll discover unique habitats, local wildlife and plants, and more.

Grab a hiking buddy and get started!

Hike To It

New maps!

Our old maps served us well for eight years, but they needed updates. Our trails have changed and we want to help folks navigate our four sites with ease.

What’s new:

– Trail difficulty noted: know what trail surface to expect before you start hiking

– Mileage markers* between trail intersections

– Key buildings labeled and updated with current names

*Markers are currently only onsite at the Main and Shepard Farm properties. Markers will be installed at the Marie and Lilly properties next year.

See Maps
